Acquisition.description:
Description of data acquisition metadata including streams, stimuli, and experimental setup.

The acquisition metadata is split into two parallel pieces: the DataStream and the StimulusEpoch.
At any given moment in time the active DataStream(s) represents all modalities of data being acquired,
while the StimulusEpoch represents all stimuli being presented.

specimen_id.description: Specimen ID is required for in vitro imaging modalities
specimen_id.title: Specimen ID

acquisition_type.description: Descriptive string detailing the type of acquisition, should be consistent across similar acquisitions for the same experiment.
acquisition_type.title: Acquisition type

coordinate_system.description: Origin and axis definitions for determining the configured position of devices during acquisition. Required when coordinates are provided within the Acquisition
coordinate_system.title: Coordinate system

calibrations.description: List of calibration measurements taken prior to acquisition.
calibrations.title: Calibrations

maintenance.description: List of maintenance on instrument prior to acquisition.
maintenance.title: Maintenance

data_streams.description: A data stream is a collection of devices that are acquiring data simultaneously. Each acquisition can include multiple streams. Streams should be split when configurations are changed.
data_streams.title: Data streams

stimulus_epochs.description: A stimulus epoch captures all stimuli being presented during an acquisition. Epochs should be split when the purpose of the stimulus changes.
stimulus_epochs.title: Stimulus

Acquisition.title: Acquisition

AcquisitionSubjectDetails.description: Details about the subject during an acquisition
AcquisitionSubjectDetails.title: AcquisitionSubjectDetails
